channel.title: The Pirate Bay Attacks Censorship With Low Orbit Server Drones
channel.description:
http://torrentfreak.com/the-pirate-bays-attacks-censorship-with-server-drones-120318/
In recent months The Pirate Bay has drastically changed its site to make it less vulnerable to ever increasing censorship attempts across the globe. But that was just the start, as the torrent site now says it’s getting ready to put some of its hardware in GPS controlled drones. “Everyone knows WHAT TPB is. Now they’re going to have to think about WHERE TPB is,” The Pirate Bay team told TorrentFreak.
... what?

item.title: The Pirate Bay Attacks Censorship With Low Orbit Server Drones

@moparisthebest wrote:

I didn’t understand this comic when I first read it, but now I do:

item.title: The Pirate Bay Attacks Censorship With Low Orbit Server Drones
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:22, topic:436829”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=539542.msg3949941#msg3949941 date=1332203888]
Wouldn’t it just be cheaper to launch a satellite in to orbit and avoid refueling costs and and lots of maintenance
[/quote]
It would be flying in a 50 km orbit away from the earth. It is satellite enough for you?[/quote]

I just read the entire article, and they don’t specifically state they will fly at an altitude of 50km. There’s no way they will reach that altitude anyways, drones used by the US reach about 15km. And they have an entire nation funding the research.

They want to fly their drones above international waters, which won’t make any difference legally. But to actually get a connection, they can only fly their drones 50km from the coast line. Most sea borders are beyond 50km, so there’s no way they can use the transmitters they claim they will be using. The only thing that remains is a satellite connection, which is expensive, requires a big dish, is slow, and I doubt ISP’s are going to be happy.

In other words, either the people behind TPB are stupid, or this is a publicity stunt.

Read full topic
item.source: The Pirate Bay Attacks Censorship With Low Orbit Server Drones

item.title: The Pirate Bay Attacks Censorship With Low Orbit Server Drones

@bowserjr2 wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

Wouldn’t it just be cheaper to launch a satellite in to orbit and avoid refueling costs and and lots of maintenance

It would be flying in a 50 km orbit away from the earth. It is satellite enough for you?

I think it would be nicer with a flying wooden airship with cannons, but that could be the future.

Read full topic

[/quote]

ever seen a vsat dish? they aint goin on no drone

item.title: The Pirate Bay Attacks Censorship With Low Orbit Server Drones
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:17, topic:436829”][quote author=Niall link=topic=539542.msg3949773#msg3949773 date=1332196114]

Air space is ‘owned’ by the country it’s above, so this might sound smart and all but it’s pointless. Unless they fly their drones above 30km, they’ll have no legal advantage.

international waters

I don’t see how that applies here
[/quote]

If you’re above international water you’re not above a country[/quote]

air space above international waters is international air space, I’d have thought that was pretty obvious

Read full topic
item.source: The Pirate Bay Attacks Censorship With Low Orbit Server Drones

If you’re above international water you’re not above a country

Even if they are in orbit above a country though, how would they go about literally “taking them down”? Surely they’re not going to fire missiles at it…[/quote]
the us wants to fire missiles at iran, what’s stopping them?
